captions.text: You wouldn't have bridges without math. I don't care at this point.
In high school and middle school I got straight A's in all math.
I was in advanced mathematics in high school.
I've taken differential equations. Multivariable calculus.  I don't know what any of those things are.
We have to find a common denominator. Denominator.
I'm not trying to be stupid, I'm not faking it, I have no idea what the f*** is going on.
The numbers are getting bigger they're not getting smaller
What are you talking about? We're still on the first problem and it's been like 10 minutes.
31 over 30.  Uh oh. Can't have that.  No. So we have to simplify that to 1 and 1, 30ths.
Here's some more fractions that we're not good at.  Does it at least come in multiples, isn't that the little thing you call it? Oh it's 10.
There's probably some 5th grader out there who's way smarter than I am.
I'm going to be a horrible father, they're gonna come to me for advice like, "Dad how do I do this?" And I'm just gonna have to fake a heart attack or something.
Eleven and three tenths. Because math.  Because math.
We already have 332 and we just started.  My elementary school teacher called this guy zero the hero.
I dunno, this is stressing me out. Where did we go wrong? Who cares?
This is a lot of work to get the answer wrong. It was almost work the 25 minutes it took to do it.
Is there a decimal in this division problem? You could honestly give me a million dollars if I got this wrong, a million dollars and I wouldn't get it.
Patience, is the key to long division. Oh I gotta put stuff up here right? I knew I borrowed wrong. Oh that's embarrassing.
How do you decide if you got like 40 cookies and five people to share them with, how do you figure out if you've got an even number of of cookies for all your friends?
Well that's easy cause I never have boxes of 82 cookies and 4321 people to feed. Nobody enjoys doing this, nobody. Oh it fits perfect!
I feel like a big boy now, this is amazing.
It's beautiful. As far as I'm concerned that is like, it's rocket science.

comments.author: Justinian Hendrix

comments.text:
On the first one: 1/3 + 7/10 is 31/30 according to my math.
To get a result of 11/30 you'd have to subtract. 
It makes sense because if you decimal it: 1/3 = 0.333... and 7/10 = 0.7
0.333...+ 0.7 = 1.0333...
So BuzzFeed FAIL!﻿

comments.author: Suelynn B

comments.text:
I wanna know how in the hell they get 11/30 from (1/3)+(7/10). Think of it 
in terms of percentage:

1/3 = 33.333... /100
7/10 = 70 /100

70+33.33 = 103.333... /100, so 1.03 should be your final answer.


~~~


If you want to do it via LCD as they were talking about in the episode, 
they still did it wrong.


The LCD of 10 and 3 is 30, so...


1/3 * 10 = 10/30
7/10 * 3 = 21/30


10+21 = 31


31/30 is your non-decimal answer... not fkn 11/30.﻿

can't back yourself up. The last generation is only calling us stupid 
because they need to make themselves feel better after realizing that WE 
didn't start wars, WE didn't screw up the economy, WE realize that we are 
here to clean up the mess that you leave us when you die, and lastly WE
